intro: Lechea mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a perennial herb native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a distinguishing botanical feature. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has opposite, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and are usually pink or purple in color. Lechea mexicana is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
